segments.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu alaṃsākaccho sabrahmacārīnaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is fit to hold a discussion with their spiritual companions.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu attanā ca sīlasampanno hoti, sīlasampadāya kathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
segments.en: A mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, and answers questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in ethics.

segments.pli: attanā ca samādhisampanno hoti, samādhisampadāya kathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
segments.en: They’re personally accomplished in immersion, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in immersion.

segments.pli: attanā ca paññāsampanno hoti, paññāsampadāya kathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
segments.en: They’re personally accomplished in wisdom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in wisdom.

segments.pli: attanā ca vimuttisampanno hoti, vimuttisampadāya kathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti;
segments.en: They’re personally accomplished in freedom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in freedom.

segments.pli: attanā ca vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno hoti, vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadāya kathāya ca āgataṃ pañhaṃ byākattā hoti.
segments.en: They’re personally accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in the knowledge and vision of freedom.

segments.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu alaṃsākaccho sabrahmacārīnan”ti.
segments.en: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to hold a discussion with their spiritual companions.”
